reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.75 ANGSTROMS) OF 3-620 IN COMPLEXES WITH CALCIUM AND THIAMINE PYROPHOSPHATE

comment.text: Catalyzes the transfer of a two-carbon ketol group from a ketose donor to an aldose acceptor, via a covalent intermediate with the cofactor thiamine pyrophosphate.
Binds 1 Mg(2+) ion per subunit. Can also utilize other divalent metal cations, such as Ca(2+), Mn(2+) and Co(2+).

disease.name: Short stature, developmental delay, and congenital heart defects
disease.description: An autosomal recessive syndrome characterized by short stature, developmental delay, intellectual disability and congenital heart defects including ventricular septal defect, atrial septal defect and patent foramen ovale. Cataract and uveitis are observed in some patients.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Insulin effects increased synthesis of Xylulose-5-Phosphate
Expressed in blood and 251 other tissues

feature.description: Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2)
In SDDHD; decreased of transketolase activity; dbSNP:rs782092363.
